content.content: Content Production Bi-Weekly Update: 10/15 - 10/28 Greetings from the Content Production Core Unit!  Analytics This monthly analytics report details the DAO’s community growth both in isolation and when compared with competing protocols. In isolation, the DAO has seen a net increase on every channel and medium. The most notable increases came through the Forum and Substack, which totaled a net increase of 75.5% over the last 90 days. Overall, we saw a net 197.39% increase across all channels. When compared to other top protocols, the Maker Community is growing at rates only rivaled by up-and-coming projects. This is shown in the ‘Posts/user by project’ chart, or (total posts)/(total users). Maker’s average of 11.47 posts per user is the highest amongst the measured platforms, and over 36% greater than BitDAO’s second-place figure of 7.22 posts per user. Note: All analytics have been gathered by hand as we still do not have access to the APIs required to automate the process.  report1943×601 38.1 KB   report 2944×733 42.5 KB   report 3943×123 10.4 KB   Sentiment https://graphs.santiment.net/makerdao-pro#social_stats Santiment uses Twitter mentions to measure positive v. negative sentiment against the price of MKR. At the time of recording, MakerDAO showed a positive net social sentiment ratio of 432 to 21.  Content Production Video   Published  [Maker Relay] Votes & Polls (10/12 - 10/18) [Maker Relay] The State of Dai (10/12-10/18) & (10/19 - 10/25)    Posted  [AMA] Collateral Onboarding CSC from CurioInvest | AMA Ep. 10 Rune Christensen presents The Decentralized Community & The Decentralized Workforce [Monthly Strategy Review] Process Review & Discussion    We’ve decided to iterate on our Votes and Polls videos by changing to follow the Monthly Governance cycle. Instead of posting weekly, we’ll have a full Monthly Governance Update posted on the first week of a new month. We believe that for viewers/listeners, this will be a more encompassing update on the position of Maker Governance after the last 30 days of voting. We have made a few iterations of the how-to-vote video, and the process which we are using to create these videos. We are currently awaiting feedback on a script for the video we will focus on next, Governance Processes. Writing  Published  Maker Relay Ep 67 and Ep 68 in collaboration with GovComms. Dai on Different Networks #15 and #16    Substack  Maker Relay Ep 67 and Ep 68  The State of Dai 09 and 10     Other   Launched Discord in collaboration with GovAlpha, TechOps, and GovComms.  Dai-Curious Dashboard & Dai on Different Networks Dashboard    Looking Ahead In the coming weeks, we’ll be:  Hosting an AMA with the Risk Core Unit  Putting the finishing touches on the revamped Community Portal  We have enabled email subscriptions on the blog so that Fixed minor design issues. We have updated the site map to reflect the old version to maintain SEO. Minor updates on the content and some work still to be done on the site map.   Attending ETH Portland and NFT NYC to rep the DAO and meet the community in person. Continuing to pursue access to the channels necessary to regularly report the relevant metrics  As always, check out our Transparency Dashboard 13 to see what we’re working on and please join us for our weekly Office Hours on Tuesdays at 14:30 UTC.
alec:  All analytics have been gathered by hand as we still do not have access to the APIs required to automate the process.   Ugh

alec:  We’ve decided to iterate on our Votes and Polls videos by changing to follow the Monthly Governance cycle. Instead of posting weekly, we’ll have a full Monthly Governance Update posted on the first week of a new month. We believe that for viewers/listeners, this will be a more encompassing update on the position of Maker Governance after the last 30 days of voting.   I think it’s more efficient, they don’t get overloaded with work, and they present more polished summaries. I didn’t know you were Maker Megaphone, I’ll follow you on Twitter again, how rude of me with a very good team.
This topic was automatically closed 30 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
